founders.name: Andres Kemeny, Founder
founders.description:
Software Engineer from Santiago, Chile.

Second-youngest LatAm founder in YC, ever.

Started programming when I was 14. Worked at two startups that went through a local accelerator powered by the Chilean government.

Gave up a scholarship and dropped out from Civil Engineering to focus 100% on Examedi.

founders.name: Juan Pablo Zepeda, Founder
founders.description:
Industrial engineer from Santiago, Chile. Dropped out of my M Sc, in Optimization to build the logistics infrastructure at Houm (YC W21), where I managed ~150 freelancers in Chile, Mexico, and Colombiaâ€”on average showing 1 real-estate property every 6 minutes.

Now I'm at Examedi, using logistics to uberize the Healthcare industry.

generated_description:
Examedi is an innovative startup based in Santiago, Chile, that launched in 2021, aiming to revolutionize healthcare in Latin America. Picture Uber, but for healthcareâ€”this is essentially what Examedi is all about. They have set out to create a seamless marketplace that connects patients with healthcare professionals, specifically nurses and lab technicians, who provide services right at the patientâ€™s home.

Their mission is clear: make healthcare more accessible and convenient for individuals across Latin America. By providing home appointments for medical lab work, they are directly addressing the challenges many face when trying to receive medical attention. 

As part of the Y Combinator Batch S21, Examedi is part of a vibrant startup community, which helps fuel their growth and innovation. With a tight-knit team of just three employees, the company is still in its early stages but certainly has the potential to grow and scale its impactful service across a broader geographic area.

Founded by a group that includes Aaron Epstein as a Group Partner, Examedi is tagged within the growing sectors of 'marketplace' and 'consumer-health-services'. 

If you're in one of the places where they currently operate, itâ€™s a service worth checking outâ€”after all, who wouldnâ€™t want healthcare delivered right to their doorstep? If you find yourself outside their operational regions, it appears they are working on expanding, so keep an eye on their website: [Examedi](https://www.examedi.com) for future developments. 

In a nutshell, Examedi is on a missionâ€”one that may very well lead to a fundamental shift in how healthcare is delivered in Latin America.
